description: Spring is a framework for developing Java applications. It is designed to make developing Java applications easier by providing a comprehensive programming model and configuration.

Vue is a progressive framework for building user interfaces. Unlike other monolithic frameworks, Vue is designed from the ground up to be incrementally adoptable. The core library is focused on the view layer only, and is easy to pick up and integrate with other libraries or existing projects. On the other hand, Vue is also perfectly capable of powering sophisticated Single-Page Applications when used in combination with modern tooling and supporting libraries.

Angular is a TypeScript-based open-source web application framework led by the Angular Team at Google and by a community of individuals and corporations to address any scale application. Angular is a complete rewrite from the same team that built AngularJS.

MySQL is an open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) that is used to store data in a structured form. MySQL is a popular database management system used by many websites and applications, and is the world's most popular database system.
PostgreSQL is a free and open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and technical standards compliance.
SQLite is a C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.
